p: As reported by Santoro et al. (2007) [ 22], the in vitro trypanocidal activity of the species Thymus vulgaris L. must be associated with the presence of thymol (80.4%). The author does not rule out the possibility that other components may be more active against T. cruzi than thymol. As a result of this study, IC 50/24 h values equal to 77 μg/mL for epimastigotes and 38 μg/mL for trypomastigotes were found; each essential oil was dissolved in DMSO for the trypanocidal activity assays.
